attributes.action: lobby Douglas Alexander (Transport Secretary) to make money available for the Leeds Supertram project again.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Leeds Supertram was cancelled by Alistair Darling in 2005. Despite the go-ahead being given to the £20bn crossrail project in London ontop of London's existing developed transport network, the £500m supertram was cancelled for being"too expensive". Leeds remains Europe's largest city without a Metro, Light Rail, Tram or Underground system, and also one of the UK's most congested cities (far more so than that of the other main cities of Birmingham, Glasgow and Sheffield),

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "lobby Douglas Alexander (Transport Secretary) to make money available for the Leeds Supertram project again."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page15206.asp
